key_points: CNN plans to review new information regarding Chris Cuomo's efforts to help his brother, former New York Governor Andrew Cuomo, amid sexual misconduct allegations.
The New York Attorney General Letitia James released documents and transcripts highlighting Chris Cuomo's more significant role than previously known.
CNN described the involvement of Chris Cuomo as 'inappropriate' but did not suspend him after initial reports surfaced in May.
Text messages show Chris Cuomo working with Melissa DeRosa, a former top aide to Andrew Cuomo, on crafting a defense strategy.
Chris Cuomo sought to use his press connections to get information on upcoming stories about the allegations.
Chris Cuomo defended contacting other journalists as a standard practice in the industry.
Chris Cuomo claimed he did not influence or control CNN's coverage of his family and had not been involved in it.
CNN stated in May that Chris Cuomo had not been involved in the network's coverage of the allegations against his brother.
Chris Cuomo apologized on air for putting his CNN colleagues in a 'bad spot' by advising his brother.
Rich Azzopardi, a spokesperson for Andrew Cuomo, criticized the release of documents by the NY Attorney General's office as a 'manipulated release.'
spokespersons: Melissa DeRosa (Former top aide to Gov. Andrew Cuomo)
